item.title: Adidas warns it will raise prices on all U.S. products due to tariffs
item.description: "Higher tariffs will eventually cause higher costs for all our products for the US market," Adidas said in a statement.

item.title: Volvo Cars shares plunge on earnings fall, withdrawn guidance and major cost-cutting drive
item.description: Volvo Group said its so-called "cost and cash action plan" would include reductions in investments and redundancies at its operations across the globe...

item.title: Novartis posts better-than-expected first-quarter sales, raises full-year guidance
item.description: Swiss pharmaceutical firm Novartis on Tuesday reported better-than-expected first-quarter sales and raised its full-year guidance.

item.title: Deutsche Bank posts 39% jump in profit, lifts credit provisions amid U.S. tariffs uncertainty
item.description: German banks stand to benefit as the country's political environment settles under the potential stewardship of a centrist coalition.

item.title: BP profit falls sharply but CEO says oil major 'off to a great start' in strategy reset
item.description: British oil giant BP on Tuesday posted slightly weaker-than-expected first-quarter net profit, following a recent strategic reset and a slump in crude...
